page.title: 14Newcastle Children's Customs
page.content: School playgrounds in Newcastle East see no hoops or tops and chalked games are rare. Ring games are few and only younger girls now skip. {Kings, Queenie, Bad Egg}and{Moving} {Target}are versions of throwing a ball at someone. {Two Baller}and{Corners} involve bouncing balls off walls, sometimes with rhythmic phrases like 'Lemonade and Fizzy pop, Plinsey mother Brown'. { Squares}is a ritual stepping game also{Squashed Tomato}which uses steps like Umbrella, Two Lamp Posts, Giant Steps also known in Yorkshire. {Tuggie {on the Wall}is a version of off-ground tig with 'guardies'. {British Bulldog} is played. {Harras}and{Scram 50}are popular team versions of hide and seek also played out of school and after dark! Forfeits include 'the nipping chamber' and 'the tickling chamber'.
